docs.text: recently one night a young director named baz luhrmann couldn't sleep .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he tumbled out of bed and moved over to the television where he watched mtv for an hour .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: then he moved to his kitchen where he spent the same amount of time eating spoiled food .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: then he took down a volume of shakespeare's work and read it cover to cover - never really paying attention to the words or plot .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and then , as a climax , he took out his video camera and pressed the " on " button .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the result ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: william shakespeare's romeo + juliet - the worst film ever made and a complete failure .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: though , to be fair , an interesting complete failure .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the idea at the film's core is to make shakespeare appealing to the crowds .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this is done by moving the camera around at a rapid rate so that we can't see what is going on .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and filming the dialogue in voice over .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and shooting leonardo dicaprio like a calvin klein model .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and making the frame go still while flashing the character's name at the bottom .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and filming long tedious action sequences in slow motion .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i mean , man , this is the 90s , dude .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: however i've seen terrible films that are fun to watch .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ( examples are batman and robin and the island of doctor moreau .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ) that rule doesn't apply here .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this is a film that takes itself seriously .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that is it's major fault .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: another problem was pointed out by my friend , alex ( who was singing songs by leonard bernstein throughout .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ) ; the original play is a powerful piece of work because the author remained neutral and didn't take sides .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: here it's clear that we are supposed to side with romeo .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ( just look at the way they film him .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ) from the begining he's our hero and this doesn't work .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and dicaprio's awful performance doesn't help .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: luhrmann never decides if he wants to entertain us or enlighten us .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the result is a mess .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you can feel him striving to be something he isn't .
docs.label: negative
